column4: I have put linux-image-386 and linux-386 on HOLD, but apt-get dist-upgrade still want to upgrade the kernels
how to prevent this ?
put the kernel version package on hold
yes of course it will work
but that's not generic
no ?
no, which is why it'll work :-)
I mean if I hold this version, and then later upgrade it manually, I will need to hold again the newly installed kernel isn't it ?
no
ok
it depends on what you want to do - what are you trying to achieve?
I don't want dist-upgrade to update the kernel
ever
that's what I tried
I have put linux-386 linux-image-386
maybe there is other packages
oh it's proably linux-meta
herm no it isn't :)
look at the binary packages provided by linux-meta
there is no package called linnux-meta
there is a source package called linux-meta -> apt-cache showsrc linux-meta
if you *remove* all the meta packages, new kernel versions won't be installed either
but it's possibly saner to put them on hold
